text: [Kevin] One chef's special, comin' right up.
Hey, what's up, guys? Welcome back to Binging with Babish,
where this week I am a guest in a dear friend's kitchen out in Delaware,
and we're gonna take a crack at Pollo a la Plancha
from "La La Land."
Oop,
Oh, I'm sorry, that is Pollo a la Plancha from "Moonlight."
We're gonna start off with something that I'm pretty bad at,
which is mise en place.
We're gonna get all of our ingredients ready
before we head over to the stove.
First, I'm gonna start with a Spanish onion
that I'm gonna cut into rings - that's gonna be our topping for the chicken.
Then we're going to butterfly and pound out
3 chicken breasts that we're going to cut open like a book
and just really go to town on,
because a great way to get juicy chicken breasts
is to flatten them out and cook them quickly over high heat.
Another great way is to marinate,
so we're going to place our chicken breasts in a Ziploc bag
along with 2 chopped cloves of garlic,
the juice of 2 limes,
(because the acidity is both going to add flavor and tenderize the chicken)
a few twists of black pepper,
a tablespoon and a half of kosher salt,
a few pinches of sugar, maybe a tablespoon of olive oil,
a pinch of cumin and cayenne pepper.
Then we're gonna give the bag a good massage
until the marinade and spices are evenly distributed,
and then we're gonna let that chill out in the fridge
for about 30 minutes while we raid our friend's liquor cabinet
and continue our mise en place.
We wanna finely chop half a Spanish onion
and half of a green bell pepper
and finely mince 2 cloves of garlic for our sofrito.
Last but not least, we're going to rinse all the starch
off of our white rice.
We're gonna take about a cup of white rice
and rinse it until the water runs clear.
And now it's finally time to get cooking.
We're going to add a cup and a half of water
to a large saucepan along with the white rice,
2 whole cloves of garlic,
a tablespoon of olive oil, a pinch of kosher salt,
and a whole bay leaf.
Then we're going to cover and simmer until the rice is tender and fluffy.
Now we're gonna sauté about 4 ounces of finely chopped bacon
in a large saucepan
(we're gonna add a little bit of water because we want to render out as much fat as possible)
before removing the bacon
and adding our sofrito to the bacon fat.
I'm not sure that things should legally be allowed to smell this good.
Sauté until the onions are soft and translucent
before adding the garlic
and sautéing for about 30 seconds or until fragrant.
Then add back the crispy bacon along with about 12 ounces of soaked black beans
and just a little bit of the soaking liquid.
Simmer over medium-low heat until soft
while we add a little bit of oil to a large cast iron griddle and begin sautéing our onions.
We want to get some good caramelized color and flavor on them,
but we want them to maintain some of their shape and firmness.
Once those are done, we're taking the chicken out of the marinade
and placing on the hot griddle.
Don't touch them, don't move them,
wait they've developed a nice color and crust
before flipping, and squeezing some fresh lime over top.
Once they're cooked through it's time to finally plate up our chef's special.
Arrange some lime slices for squeezing
and use a plastic container to mold the rice.
Add some of our beautiful black beans,
garnish from up high with some chopped cilantro,
don't forget to top the chicken with your fried onions
and it's time to dig in.
Now this was all delicious, but these black beans were something else.
I would eat them for breakfast.
Welcome to Binging with Babish you guys,
this is a Patreon exclusive
uh...
You're seeing my face, that's also Patreon exclusive
Am I... Are you seeing my face?
Someone offscreen: Yeah
Someone offscreen: What does Patriarch mean?
*laughing*
